body.p: In the video, brightly colored dye pours into a glass of water. The dye molecules move from an area of high concentration at the point of entry into the water, then move to the area of low concentration throughout the water and over time dissipate towards equilibrium through the glass of water.
If you performed this experiment by pouring the dye into hot water, what do you think would happen to the rate of diffusion?

multiple_choice.choice: It would have no effect on it

feedback.p: Correct. Heat increases kinetic energy which would result in an increased diffusion rate.
Incorrect. Think about the effect of heat on kinetic energy and remember that kinetic energy drives diffusion.
Incorrect. Think about how temperature affects kinetic energy, the higher the kinetic energy the faster the diffusion rate.

hint.p: Kinetic energy is the driving force for diffusion, anything that increases kinetic energy will increase the diffusion rate.

body.p: If you performed this experiment by pouring a larger molecule substance than the water, what do you think would happen to the rate of diffusion?

multiple_choice.choice: It would have no effect on it

feedback.p: Incorrect. Larger particles require more energy in order to move.
Correct. Larger particles have less velocity and kinetic energy which results in a slower diffusion rate.
Incorrect. Larger particles require more energy in order to move, which does affect the rate of diffusion.

hint.p: Kinetic energy is the driving force for diffusion, anything that increases kinetic energy will increase the diffusion rate.

body.p: If you performed this experiment in a thick gel instead of water, what do you think would happen to the rate of diffusion?

multiple_choice.choice: It would have no effect on it

feedback.p: Incorrect. The more viscous ("thicker") the medium the slower the rate of diffusion.
Correct. Diffusion is also affected by the viscosity ("thickness") of the medium the molecules are moving through.
Incorrect. Diffusion is affected by the viscosity of the medium the molecules are moving through. A more viscous ("thicker") medium will slow them down and decrease diffusion rate.

hint.p: Diffusion is the movement of molecules from an area of high to low concentration. Would this be faster or slower in a thicker medium?
